intro: Verbascum condensatum, commonly known as the woolly mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are broad, lobed, and covered in a dense layer of soft, woolly hairs. Verbascum condensatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
